repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Close #31531

Problem: Can not use id as filter condition to get autocmds.

Solution: add id which support integer or array to filter get autocmds


PS: test and doc later

comment_data.body: Is there a strong need to support array? If someone has an id they usually just want 1 result.
If this _smart guy_ does not use group to create some autocmds then store these ids. Then he wants to get something from the ids at some runtime.  I don't have any strong ideas 🤔 if so just id.
keeping the code simple (no array support) is probably worth it for now
while we're here, sort these key names? they are in random order.

"retrieves" is an overly verbose word
```suggestion
      it('gets events by ID', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -881,6 +881,93 @@ describe('autocmd api', function()
         eq([[:echo "Buffer"]], normalized_aus[1].command)
       end)
     end)
+
+    describe('id', function()
+      local _id, _id1
+      after_each(function()
+        api.nvim_del_autocmd(_id)
+        if _id1 then
+          api.nvim_del_autocmd(_id1)
+          _id1 = nil
+        end
+      end)
+
+      it('retrieves events using an ID', function()

comment_data.body: there is a TODO on line 96 that can be deleted now
param and result fields were in random order, so I inserted it at the end. Reorder all
why is this needed? is clear() not called for each test?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -881,6 +881,93 @@ describe('autocmd api', function()
         eq([[:echo "Buffer"]], normalized_aus[1].command)
       end)
     end)

+          _id1 = nil

comment_data.body:
id is the only thing that really matters for each of these tests, right?

need a test for when id is not found?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -881,6 +881,93 @@ describe('autocmd api', function()
         eq([[:echo "Buffer"]], normalized_aus[1].command)
       end)
     end)
+
+    describe('id', function()
+      local _id, _id1
+      after_each(function()
+        api.nvim_del_autocmd(_id)
+        if _id1 then
+          api.nvim_del_autocmd(_id1)
+          _id1 = nil
+        end
+      end)
+
+      it('gets events by ID', function()
+        _id = api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufEnter', {
+          command = 'echo "hello"',
+        })
+        eq({
+          {
+            buflocal = false,
+            command = 'echo "hello"',
+            event = 'BufEnter',
+            id = _id,
+            once = false,
+            pattern = '*',
+          },
+        }, api.nvim_get_autocmds({ id = _id }))
+      end)
+
+      it('gets events by ID and group', function()
+        local group_name = 'NVIM_GET_AUTOCMDS_ID'
+        local group = api.nvim_create_augroup(group_name, { clear = true })
+        _id = api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufEnter', {
+          command = 'set number',
+          group = group,
+        })
+        _id1 = api.nvim_create_autocmd('WinEnter', {
+          group = group,
+          command = 'set cot&',
+        })
+        eq({
+          {
+            buflocal = false,
+            command = 'set number',
+            event = 'BufEnter',
+            group = group,
+            group_name = group_name,
+            id = _id,
+            once = false,
+            pattern = '*',
+          },
+        }, api.nvim_get_autocmds({ id = _id, group = group }))
+      end)
+
+      it('gets events by ID and a specific event', function()
+        _id = api.nvim_create_autocmd('InsertEnter', { command = 'set number' })
+        _id1 = api.nvim_create_autocmd('InsertEnter', {
+          command = 'set wrap',
+        })
+        eq({
+          {
+            buflocal = false,
+            command = 'set number',
+            event = 'InsertEnter',
+            id = _id,
+            once = false,
+            pattern = '*',
+          },
+        }, api.nvim_get_autocmds({ id = _id, event = 'InsertEnter' }))
+      end)
+
+      it('gets events by ID and a specific pattern', function()

@@ -881,6 +881,93 @@ describe('autocmd api', function()
         eq([[:echo "Buffer"]], normalized_aus[1].command)
       end)
     end)
+
+    describe('id', function()
+      local _id, _id1
+      after_each(function()
+        api.nvim_del_autocmd(_id)
+        if _id1 then
+          api.nvim_del_autocmd(_id1)
+          _id1 = nil

comment_data.body: also updated the type  use integer and table instead of number array.

let's just have 1 test for the "with other filters" case. we don't need to test every permutation. you can merge some of the filters from the below tests into this test, if possible, then drop the tests below.

```suggestion
      it('gets events by ID and other filters', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -899,6 +899,89 @@ describe('autocmd api', function()
         eq([[:echo "Buffer"]], normalized_aus[1].command)
       end)
     end)
+
+    describe('id', function()
+      it('gets events by ID', function()
+        local id = api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufEnter', {
+          command = 'echo "hello"',
+        })
+        eq({
+          {
+            buflocal = false,
+            command = 'echo "hello"',
+            event = 'BufEnter',
+            id = id,
+            once = false,
+            pattern = '*',
+          },
+        }, api.nvim_get_autocmds({ id = id }))
+      end)
+
+      it('gets events by ID and group', function()

comment_regular_data.body: LGTM after condensing the tests. Why in draft?
Is there any reason to keep it still unmerged?

title: fix(api): support get autocmds by id in api
